title: travelplanner: Please assist in devising a week-long travel plan for a party of 5. We will depart from Marquette with the aim of visiting 3 cities in Michigan between March 6th and March 12th, 2022. Our budget is now set at $14,600. We should emphasize that our accommodations must be suitable for children under 10. (ad2e879c786b3a03)

always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan!

chat_history.name: restaurant_search

chat_history.content:
## Itinerary

### Monday, March 6th:
- 15:54: Fly from Marquette to Detroit (Flight F3835289, $97 per person).
- 17:20: Arrive in Detroit.
- Check-in at accommodation.

Accommodation:
- *Comfy King Bed Feet from Subway* ($568 per night). This private room with a king-sized bed is conveniently situated near a subway station, providing easy access to transportation for your family's exploration of Detroit.

### Tuesday, March 7th:
- Visit the Detroit Zoo (8450 W 10 Mile Rd, Royal Oak). The zoo is home to a diverse range of animals, including lions, giraffes, and penguins.
- Enjoy lunch at Southern Bliss Bakery (average cost $28). This bakery offers a variety of cuisines, including tea, BBQ, seafood, and desserts.
- Visit the Detroit Institute of Arts (5200 Woodward Ave). Explore the extensive art collections and exhibitions featuring works from various periods and cultures.
- Visit the Motown Museum (2648 Berry Gordy Jr. Boulevard). Learn about the history of Motown Records and its influence on music, and view memorabilia from iconic artists.
- Dinner at A Dong Restaurant (average cost $40). This restaurant offers tea, pizza, and cafe options.

### Wednesday, March 8th:
- Detroit Riverfront Conservancy (600 Renaissance Center #1720). Stroll along the Detroit Riverfront and enjoy the scenic views, or participate in recreational activities like cycling or rollerblading.
- Detroit Historical Museum (5401 Woodward Ave). Discover Detroit's rich history through interactive exhibits and artefacts.
- Lunch at Vapour Pub & Brewery (average cost $80). This venue offers French, BBQ, fast food, cafe, and seafood options.
- Comerica Park (2100 Woodward Ave). Tour the home of the Detroit Tigers baseball team and visit the museum showcasing the team's history.
- Detroit Science Center (5020 John R St). Engage in hands-on exhibits and interactive displays exploring various scientific concepts.
- Dinner at Cafe 6 (average cost $27). This restaurant offers BBQ, pizza, and desserts.

### Thursday, March 9th:
- Detroit Segway Tours & Rides (2934 Russell St). Experience Detroit from a unique perspective on a guided Segway tour, covering various city highlights.
- Charles H. Wright Museum of African American History (315 E Warren Ave). Explore the rich history and culture of African Americans through exhibits and educational programs.
- Lunch at Bistro Flamme Bois (average cost $100). The restaurant offers Chinese, bakery, and BBQ options.
- Belle Isle Aquarium (3 Inselruhe Ave). Visit the historic aquarium on Belle Isle, featuring various aquatic species and interactive exhibits.
- Dinner at Mandap - Hotel Express Towers (average cost $37). The restaurant offers pizza and fast food.

### Friday, March 10th:
- Grand Circus Park (101-157 Witherell St). Enjoy this public park in the heart of Detroit, offering a relaxing environment with landscaped gardens and a water feature.
- Ford Piquette Avenue Plant Museum (461 Piquette Ave). Tour the birthplace of the Model T and learn about the history of Ford Motor Company.
- Lunch at Taksim (average cost $65). This cafe offers bakery, Indian, and fast food options.
- Campus Martius Park (800 Woodward Ave). Relax in this downtown park, featuring a large open space, water features, and seasonal events.
- Museum of Contemporary Art Detroit (4454 Woodward Ave). Engage with contemporary art exhibitions, featuring local and international artists.
- Dinner at Zabardast Indian Kitchen (average cost $76). Enjoy bakery, desserts, and seafood at this restaurant.

### Saturday, March 11th:
- Beacon Park (1901 Grand River Ave). Spend time in this scenic park featuring a variety of recreational activities, including a unique playground and a beer garden.
- Henry Ford Museum of American Innovation (20900 Oakwood Blvd, Dearborn). Explore the history of American innovation through interactive exhibits, featuring cars, planes, and more.
- Lunch at Rehmatullah's Hotel (average cost $28). A variety of cuisines are on offer here, including desserts, tea, pizza, Italian, and Mediterranean.
- Detroit Riverwalk (1340 Atwater St). Take a relaxing walk along the Detroit River, enjoying the waterfront views and the vibrant atmosphere.
- Dinner at Southern Bliss Bakery (average cost $28).

### Sunday, March 12th:
- Spend the morning exploring any remaining attractions or revisiting your favourite spots.
- Depart Detroit for your next destination.

This itinerary offers a blend of cultural, historical, and recreational activities, ensuring a well-rounded experience for your family in Detroit. Please note that the accommodation and restaurants chosen do not have specific age restrictions for children, but it's advisable to review their policies directly to ensure they cater to your family's needs.

I was unable to find flights from Detroit to other cities in Michigan on your specified departure date. Therefore, I have only planned for your time in Detroit. I also couldn't find details of attractions in other cities which are suitable for children under 10.

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
